meanings.definition: Behind in place; in the rear.
meanings.sent1: She walked ahind the group of friends.
meanings.sent2: The dog followed close behind, always ahind.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel played a game of tag, always ending up ahind.
meanings.sent4: The moon peeked out from ahind the clouds, shy and hidden.
meanings.sent5: The treasure was buried deep ahind the old oak tree.

meanings.sent1: The ahind bus arrived just as the sun set.
meanings.sent2: He apologized for being ahind to the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The ahind clock seemed to mock his tardiness.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams always felt ahind, like echoes of the past.
meanings.sent5: The ahind train whistle signaled the end of the day.

meanings.sent1: The soldiers marched ahind the general.
meanings.sent2: The children ran happily, playing ahind the house.
meanings.sent3: The cat always preferred to walk ahind the curtains.
meanings.sent4: The truth was hidden ahind a veil of lies.
meanings.sent5: The answer lay ahind the last page of the book.
